context: On <a0_0><b10_0>September 27, 2010<b10_0/><a0_0/>, Public Safety Canada partnered with STOP.THINK.CONNECT, <b5_0><b9_0>a coalition<b5_0/> of non-profit, private sector, and government organizations dedicated to informing the general public on how to protect themselves online<b9_0/>. On <a1_0>February 4, <b13_0>2014<b13_0/><a1_0/>, the Government of Canada launched the <b6_0>Cyber Security<b6_0/> Cooperation Program. The program is a <a4_0><b11_0>$1.5 million<b11_0/><a4_0/> five-year initiative aimed at improving Canada’s cyber systems through grants and contributions to projects in support of this objective. Public Safety Canada aims to begin an evaluation of Canada's Cyber Security Strategy in <b12_0>early 2015<b12_0/>. <a2_0>Public Safety Canada<a2_0/> administers and routinely updates <b7_0>the GetCyberSafe portal for Canadian citizens<b7_0/>, and carries out Cyber Security <b8_0>Awareness<b8_0/> Month during <a3_0><b14_0>October<b14_0/><a3_0/>.
